body_html:
@mdeff: According to this section of PEP404 "Pre-releases of any kind, including developmental releases, are implicitly excluded from all version specifiers, unless they are already present on the system, explicitly requested by the user, or if the only available version that satisfies the version specifier is a pre-release."

Maybe the functionality regarding the last part of that sentence was implemented after pip-1.5.4. You can also get this behavior by explicitly adding the --pre option to the pip install command.

But as the >= comparison combined with pre-release version specifiers already works in pip-1.5.4, this should not be a problem here.
